subject: RE: [junit] Parsing Junit test results
msgSnippet: Hi Stefan, I once started to extend XMLResultFormatter, but ended up implementing the underlying interface myself and looking to XMLResultFormatter as a
messageBody:
Hi Stefan,

I once started to extend XMLResultFormatter, but ended up implementing the underlying interface myself and looking to XMLResultFormatter as a reference point.

It's been a while, but I think the main thought I had was that formatting and capturing results responsibilities should be separated, instead of doing the formatting inline with the event listening methods.

One pattern would be to capture all the results to collections in memory, then run them through a formatting method. The format method would be a template method, open for extension.

Scott Stirling
Framingham, MA

-----Original Message-----
From: Stefan Bodewig [mailto:bodewig@...]
Sent: Wed 8/27/2003 2:45 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Cc:
Subject: Re: [junit] Parsing Junit test results



Hi Jeff et al,

I am an Ant committer and just wanted to show up and offer some help.

XMLResultFormatter has obviously not been designed for extension and
I'll be happy to go into refactoring it so that you don't need to
reinvent the wheel or use core reflection to get the job done.

One of the first steps I'd like to take is to simply add the class
name of the test class as an attribute to the <testcase> elements,
this shouldn't break any existing stylesheets and fill a gap that's
currently there.

After that I'd like to split the monolithic methods into pieces that
can be overridden - here the feedback of all people that have
extended that class will be extremely valuable.

Cheers

Stefan
